link.synopsis: In this sex comedy based on the Italian adult comic book "Click" by Milo Manara, the nearly bankrupt Body Beautiful Gym fights off financial ruin by advertising an electronic workout gizmo that sends fitness seekers into erotic frenzies. No one is immune -- not the weightlifters, not the sauna soakers and certainly not the evil corporate raider (Nina Leichtling) who hopes to get her mitts on the gym.
link.title: synopsis
Rod Steele 0014: You Only Live Until You Die
The Exotic House of Wax: Legacy of Lust
Timegate: Tales of the Saddle Tramps
Bikini Chain Gang / Bikini Airways: Double Feature
Bikini Girls from the Lost Planet
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Can I Do It ... Til I Need Glasses?
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
Wild Things: Diamonds in the Rough
The Knack...and How to Get It

link.synopsis: In Neil LaBute's black comedy, Kansas waitress Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger in a Golden Globe-winning performance) falls hard for soap opera star George McCord (Greg Kinnear) -- and follows that obsession after her husband is killed in front of her by hit men Charlie (Morgan Freeman) and Wesley (Chris Rock). In a delusional daze, Betty heads to Los Angeles to be with the soap star -- unaware of the drug cache in her car or the men following her.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

link.synopsis: This BAFTA Best Film Award winner spins through a merry-go-round of love affairs that come full circle in early 1900s Vienna. Told through a series of vignettes, this lyrical comedy is held together by the narrative overlay of a sage interlocutor. Each episode introduces a new character who has an affair with a character from the previous scene, eventually bringing the story back to its beginning. Max Ophuls directs.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

link.title: Les Dames du Bois de Boulogne
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Bathing-suit manufacturer Eve (Esther Williams) tries to help when her dim sister (Betty Garrett) falls for a masseur (Red Skelton), believing he's Latin polo star Jose O'Rourke. Afraid the truth will crush her sister, Eve locates the dashing O'Rourke (Ricardo Montalban) -- but soon falls in love with him. This musical comedy of errors, which features Williams's trademark water ballets, won a Best Song Oscar for "Baby, It's Cold Outside."
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
By the Light of the Silvery Moon

link.synopsis: In this likable comedy helmed by Alan J. Pakula, reluctantly divorced Phil Potter (Burt Reynolds) moves to Boston, where he meets romance-wary schoolteacher Marilyn Holmberg (Jill Clayburgh). Phil's charms ultimately win Marilyn over, but before he commits himself, his capricious ex-wife, Jessica (Candice Bergen), appears on the scene and reignites his feelings for her. Will Jessica derail Phil's promising new relationship?
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Jimmy Connors (Mickey Rooney) and Mary Holden (Judy Garland) put on a show to raise cash so the musical kids in town can enter a prestigious orchestra competition. But the real world tangles with their dream, and soon it's unclear whether they'll make it to the contest. Hollywood's musical master Busby Berkeley directs this musical comedy, which won an Oscar for Best Sound and nominations for Best Score and Song.
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Juke Joint / Reet, Petite and Gone
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: This lively musical comedy stars Frank Sinatra as philandering theater agent Charlie Reader, who falls hard for aspiring actress Julie Gillis (Debbie Reynolds). But does he have what it takes to be a one-woman man when Julie demands he drop his other love interests? Meanwhile, Charlie's best pal (David Wayne) gets chummy with Charlie's ex (Celeste Holm). The title song earned an Oscar nod -- and a permanent spot in Sinatra's repertoire.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
With a Song in My Heart
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini

link.synopsis: &NFb;&NFb_;&NFb;&NFb_;Bollywood mania invades the screen in this wacky romantic comedy starring Marisa Tomei, Heather Graham and Jimi Mistry. When an Indian dancer (Mistry) decides he wants to become an actor, he heads for New York City and the lights of Broadway. Instead, he becomes a waiter. But when he's mistaken for a sex guru, he hits it big and must choose between fame and his burgeoning love for Sharonna (Graham), a porn star with a heart of gold.
link.title: synopsis
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

link.synopsis: John Woo directs this action-packed comedy that stars Chow Yun-Fat, Leslie Cheung and Cherie Chung as a trio of art thieves who grew up together as orphans under the tutelage of a cruel crime boss named Chow (Kenneth Tsang). Although Red Bean (Chung) wants the trio to leave their life of crime behind, a million-dollar opportunity -- stealing a priceless French painting -- proves too alluring for the men ... but the heist ends in disaster.
link.title: synopsis
Once a Thief: Brother Against Brother
Bruce Lee: The True Game of Death

link.synopsis: Ellen Burstyn, Diane Ladd and Olympia Dukakis head the cast as a trio of recently widowed Jewish women whose friendship helps ease the passing of their spouses -- until one of them meets an empathetic widower and embarks on a tentative romance. Set in Pittsburgh, this old-fashioned comedy also stars Lainie Kazan, Christina Ricci and Danny Aiello as Ben Katz, the man who drives a wedge between the ladies.
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood
How to Make an American Quilt
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Burt Lancaster stars in this comedy set on the high seas in the 1700s. A sea captain (Lancaster) has a fine racket going: His crew pretends to be stricken with scurvy so they can take over other royal vessels. But how long can he continue his streak? Get your fill of naval battles and swordplay in this campy tribute to the classic swashbuckling films of Errol Flynn and Douglas Fairbanks Sr.
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
I'll Get You / Fingerprints Don't Lie
The Man from Cairo / Mask of the Dragon
I'll See You in My Dreams

link.synopsis: Fans of Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy will rejoice at this fine collection of classic movies featuring the wacky pair, including Sons of the Desert, The Music Box, Another Fine Mess, Busy Bodies and County Hospital. Get ready for a healthy dose of the unforgettable antics that have made Laurel and Hardy icons of comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Laurel & Hardy: This Is Your Life / Laurel & Hardy at the Movies
Slapstick Symposium: The Charley Chase Collection 2
Laurel & Hardy: Air Raid Wardens / Nothing But Trouble
Laurel & Hardy: Be Big / A Lucky Dog
Laurel & Hardy: March of the Wooden Soldiers
The Laurel & Hardy Collection: Vol. 2: Alone and Together
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
Slapstick Symposium: The Stan Laurel Collection: Vol. 2
Kings of Comedy: Masters of the Silent Screen
Slapstick Symposium: The Oliver Hardy Collection
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
Snow White and the Three Stooges
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
Jayne Mansfield Collection: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw

link.synopsis: Mediterranean ferryboat captain Henry St. James (Alec Guinness) has things well organized for himself: He's got a loving, "veddy" English wife (Celia Johnson) in Gibraltar and a possessive, hot-blooded mistress (Yvonne De Carlo) in Tangiers. A perfect arrangement, as long as he can keep them apart. But what happens when one woman decides to follow him to the other port? This romantic comedy from Britain was nominated for a Best Writing Oscar.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
An Ideal Husband / Lady Windermere's Fan
A Guide for the Married Man
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Part lawyer, part detective, Horace Rumpole -- with his brilliant mind and sly sense of humor -- is one of the most colorful characters ever to approach the bench, as seen in John Mortimer's Emmy-nominated series. Rumpole's adventures both behind the scenes and center stage in the British legal system are a delightful mix of comedy, mystery and courtroom drama. Justice has never been served with such style and wit.
link.title: synopsis
Rumpole of the Bailey: The Lost Episode
Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: Five Red Herrings
Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: Murder Must Advertise
Dorothy L. Sayers Mysteries: Gaudy Night
Kavanagh Q.C.: Nothing But the Truth
Murder Most English: The Complete Series
Lord Peter Wimsey Mysteries: The Nine Tailors
Dorothy L. Sayers Mysteries: Have His Carcase
Inspector Morse 1: The Dead of Jericho
Agatha Christie's Tommy & Tuppence: Partners in Crime
Sherlock Holmes: The Sign of Four
Miss Marple Mysteries: A Pocketful of Rye
Inspector Morse 6: The Settling of the Sun
Inspector Morse 3: Service of All the Dead

title.regular: Rumpole of the Bailey: Series 1 and 2
title.short: Rumpole of the Bailey: Series 1 and 2

link.synopsis: Frank Capra directed this 1931 screwball comedy about a hard-nosed newspaper reporter, Stew (Robert Williams), who, after marrying heiress Ann Schuyler (Jean Harlow), must find a way to adjust to high society. After finding it stifling, he sets about writing a play with a female colleague, Gallagher (Loretta Young), who promptly falls for Stew. Hijinks and witty repartee move faster than breaking copy as the two women vie for Stew's affections.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Heroes for Sale / Wild Boys of the Road
You Can't Take It with You
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Mabel and Tom are an upper-class African-American couple in the 1970s who discover racism literally in their own backyard. After Tom is promoted at his law firm, they move their family to an all-white neighborhood where they are clearly not welcome. What happens next is a testament to the force of willpower and the human spirit in this comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg and Danny Glover, and co-produced by Spike Lee.
link.title: synopsis
Best of Platinum Comedy Series: Vol. 1
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Former U.S. President Monroe Cole (Gene Hackman) plans to retire in a small northeastern coastal town, but he has his hands full when he tries to fill an empty mayoral seat. The unlikely opposition comes from unassuming hardware store owner Handy Harrison (Ray Romano). Harrison quickly proves to be a bona fide man of the people -- and wildly popular. This comedy also stars Maura Tierney and Marcia Gay Harden.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
The Brady Bunch in the White House

link.synopsis: Self-proclaimed redneck Jeff Foxworthy is back doing what he does best: poking fun at anything country in this double feature of comedy specials, including his now-classic "Your Might Be a Redneck" routine.
link.title: synopsis
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Bill Engvall: A Decade of Laughs
Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
I Don't Know How She Does It
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy

title.regular: Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck / Check Your Neck
title.short: Jeff Foxworthy: You Might Be a Redneck

link.synopsis: Playing silver-tongued Gardner Barnes, Kevin Costner heads a first-rate ensemble cast in this likable comedy -- set in 1971 -- about five newly minted college graduates who pile into a vintage Cadillac for their final weekend fling together. The quintet's comical escapades include pit stops in Podunk towns, a fireworks fight in a cemetery and spur-of-the-moment skydiving ... but adulthood and real life await them at the end of the line.
link.title: synopsis
Fandango: Searching for the White Monkey
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: This unusual comedy catches its characters at various moments of loneliness, identity crisis and despair. Marilou Berry plays Lolita Cassard, a young woman disgusted with the world's seeming inability to accept beauty in all forms. Her neglectful father, Etienne Cassard (Jean-Pierre Bacri), wants so badly to have someone to love, and when they meet up with the equally lost Sylvia (Agnès Jaoui) and Pierre (Laurent Grévill), all hell breaks loose.
link.title: synopsis
The Romance of Astrea and Celadon

link.synopsis: Leading black comics Dave Chappelle, Martin Lawrence, Steve Harvey and Keenan Wayans deliver wicked zingers and hilarious routines in this collection of performances that laid the groundwork for their future ranking at the top of the heap in humor. No topic is off limits for these jokers, who -- with irreverent wit and impeccable timing -- prove that in the deck of comedy cards, they are indeed the kings.
link.title: synopsis
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Best of Platinum Comedy Series: Vol. 1
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Platinum Comedy Series: Tracy Morgan: Life, Love & Lust
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
TK Kirkland: Are There Any Questions?
Inside the Actors Studio: Dave Chappelle
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 3
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2
Alonzo Bodden: Tall, Dark and Funny
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Directed by Douglas Barr, this frothy, made-for-cable comedy stars Shannon Elizabeth as beautiful bride-to-be Samantha Hoyt, whose fairy-tale wedding plans are unraveling fast. As if clashes with the future in-laws and an interfaith dilemma aren't enough, the beleaguered Samantha faces more angst when Luke (Geoff Stults), her former college crush, suddenly walks back into her life. Extras include cast and crew interviews and deleted scenes.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: When petty crooks Harry Valentini (Danny DeVito) and Moe Dickstein (Joe Piscopo) "borrow" a large sum of cash from a Mafia boss (Dan Hedaya), they head to the track to multiply their stolen gains. But when their bets go belly-up, they're at the mercy of hit men hired to make them pay. Brian De Palma directs this cracked-up comedy in a departure from his usual fare, following the exploits of two common thieves who lack the gift of common sense.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Based on a World War II-era magazine article that originally ran in &NFi;The New Yorker&NFi_;, this slapstick comedy stars Gary Cooper as first-time Navy commander Lt. John Harkness, a well-intentioned officer whose attempts to master an experimental steam-powered vessel (known affectionately as the &NFi;U.S.S. Teakettle&NFi_;) inadvertently launch a floating disaster. A young Charles Bronson co-stars in his feature-film debut.
link.title: synopsis
The Wreck of the Mary Deare
The Wackiest Ship in the Army
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
Laurel & Hardy: Air Raid Wardens / Nothing But Trouble
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps
Snow White and the Three Stooges
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Lives of a Bengal Lancer

link.synopsis: Emmy-nominated comedian Damon Wayans, who's perhaps best known for his work on the groundbreaking comedy sketch show "In Living Color," has a knack for creating funny characters. But he plays his most hilarious character yet in this gut-busting HBO special filmed live in front of an appreciative audience: himself. Riffing on marriage, kids, work and a variety of other topics, Wayans proves he's still relevant in the cutthroat world of stand-up.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Jamie Foxx: Straight from the Foxxhole
Sinbad: Son of a Preacher Man
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
If the Shoe Fits Wear It
I Think I Love My Wife
Rerun's In The Hood / Rerun's Comedy Jam

link.synopsis: Entertainment moguls, eccentric comedians and corporate politics detonate in this behind-the-scenes dramedy about a popular late-night comedy sketch show, offering a cynical view of neurotic on-air talent and egomaniacal network execs. Matthew Perry and Bradley Whitford lead the ensemble cast as creative team Matt Albie and Danny Tripp in this no-nonsense series created by Aaron Sorkin ("The West Wing").
link.title: synopsis
The Book of Daniel: The Complete Series
My Own Worst Enemy: The Complete Series
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tom Hanks
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jimmy Fallon
A Wayfarer's Journey: Listening to Mahler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey

title.regular: Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: In this sexually ambiguous romantic comedy, Luke, a naive college student (Taylor Handley), struggles with issues of masculinity while he comes to terms with a rare genetic disorder that causes the afflicted to switch gender at will. Unable to control his body and emotions, Luke spirals into sheer panic when he discovers that as a zerophiliac, the lines between love, sex and gender are rapidly disappearing … but his options are multiplying.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: When sexually frustrated salon owner Charlotte (Trine Dyrholm) moves into a new apartment, she's initially wary of her neighbor, a male-to-female transsexual named Veronica (David Dencik). But they form an unlikely friendship after sharing the drama of Veronica's suicide attempt. While it embraces sexually ambiguous humor, this dark comedy from director Pernille Fischer Christensen is, in the end, a touching homage to friendship between women.
link.title: synopsis
The Bitter Tears of Petra Von Kant

link.synopsis: Struggling actor Reginald "Cool" Coolidge (Dorian Missick) can't seem to catch a break: As if the lack of good roles for African-Americans isn't enough, he learns his ex-girlfriend (Zoe Saldana) is getting married in just 36 hours. Still in love with her, Cool launches a final bid to win her back and tackles the most important role of his life. Hill Harper and Tonya Pinkins also star in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man

link.synopsis: On the advice of his therapist (Don Cheadle), depressed and down-on-his-luck writer Solo (Giovanni Ribisi) purchases a pooch for companionship -- and gets all kinds of trouble instead. With his four-legged pal dragging him forward, Solo's world expands to include a comely stripper, a short-fused loan shark, a high-society dog collector and more in this comedy of errors co-starring Lynn Collins, Kevin Corrigan and Mena Suvari.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Bullied by his students and ignored by his family, mousy teacher Shin'ichi Ichikawa (Sho Aikawa) dresses up as Zebraman, a long-ago TV hero, as an escape. But when a UFO crashes outside of town, Ichikawa must come to the rescue for real. Director Takashi Miike reveals whether Ichikawa can pull it off in this black comedy about channeling your inner superhero.
link.title: synopsis
20th Century Boys: Chapter 2: The Last Hope
Freezer Burn: The Invasion of Laxdale
Starship Troopers 2: Hero of the Federation

link.synopsis: Country star Glen Campbell showcases his music in a series of highlights from his 1969 variety program "The Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour," playing hits such as "Wichita Lineman" and performing alongside Johnny Cash, Cher, Willie Nelson and more. Also included are hilarious comedy sketches from the show and more recent interviews with Campbell sharing his fondest memories of the program and his guests.
link.title: synopsis
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
Best of Barbara Mandrell & the Mandrell Sisters Show
Merle Haggard: Live from Austin TX '78
The Best of The Johnny Cash TV Show: 1969-1971
The Highwaymen: On the Road Again
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
The Dick Cavett Show: Hollywood Greats
The Dick Cavett Show: Ray Charles Collection
Saturday Night Live: 25 Years of Music
Carnegie Hall at 100: A Place of Dreams
Larry King Live: Greatest Interviews Collection
Jerry Springer: Undressed, Unleashed, Uncensored!: Vol. 2
Mitzi Gaynor: Razzle Dazzle! The Special Years
The Tomorrow Show: Tom Snyder's Electric Kool-Aid Talk Show
The Best Moments of the Amazing Kreskin
Martin Scorsese Presents: The Blues: A Musical Journey
In the House with Peter Bart & Peter Guber
The Oprah Winfrey Show: 20th Anniversary Collection
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
Louis Armstrong: The Louis Armstrong Show
Inside the Actors Studio: Barbra Streisand
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
Later... with Jools Holland: Cool Britannia
Jerry Lee Lewis: The Jerry Lee Lewis Show

link.synopsis: Dave Attell -- best known for his late-night comedy show, "Insomniac" -- brings his quick-witted delivery and sarcastic humor to the stages of Washington, D.C.'s Lincoln Theatre for this outlandish live performance that originally aired on HBO. Riffing on dating, current events, celebrities and the subject closest to his heart -- drinking -- Attell demonstrates to full effect how he's earned his rep as a comic's comic.
link.title: synopsis
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst
An Evening with Kevin Smith 2: Evening Harder
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
Vermilion Pleasure Night: Vol. 1: Optic Erotica
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Secret Diary of a Call Girl
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection

link.synopsis: Ron (Josh Cooke) is ready to settle down and get married, but first, he must survive his out-of-control bachelor party. With his best buds shoving booze, women and more booze in his face, Ron is going to have a tough time fighting temptation. Stripper fights, a sex addicts' convention and male nudity all lead to solid laughs in this outrageous sequel to the 1984 comedy hit Bachelor Party.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: This romantic comedy centers on peace-loving Rajput Jai (Imran Khan, in his film debut) and spitfire beauty Aditi (Genelia D'Souza), complete opposites who can't see what their family and friends know to be true -- that they're a perfect match despite their differences. Meanwhile, their lovelorn friends, Rotlu and Bombs, hold on to the hope that the two never fall in love. Abbas Tyrewala directs and A.R. Rahman composes the film score.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Neve Campbell stars as a waitress in this comedy about five women working dead-end jobs in a London restaurant while they nurture their alter identities as a writer, an artist, an actor, a lover and a revolutionary. But before they can realize their dreams, they have to make it through the next shift. Oana Pellea, Anna Maxwell Martin, Shirley Henderson and Alexandra Maria Lara co-star in director Oliver Parker's ensemble film.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: Dashing magazine editor Matt (Philipp Karner) dumps all potential boyfriends when they don't measure up to his high school flame, Ryan. So when Matt learns that Ryan (James O'Shea) is getting married -- to a woman (Tori Spelling) -- he rushes back to his Arizona hometown to investigate. There, he makes another confounding discovery: He actually likes the bride. Sexual identity crises ensue in this warmhearted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
A Home at the End of the World
Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

link.synopsis: In this hit musical comedy from the Dominican Republic, the charming -- and broke -- Genaro (Fausto Mata) tries to land a visa to the United States or Europe by wooing a series of beautiful tourists visiting the Caribbean nation. But when some of the women compare notes, his romantic efforts begin to fizzle. Will the smooth-talking Genaro maintain his increasingly complicated charade and secure a coveted visa?
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
Islands of the Caribbean: The Bahamas, Jamaica & Santo Domingo
1888: El Extraordinario Viaje de la Santa Isabel
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: In this outrageous sequel to Another Gay Movie, best friends Andy (Jake Mosser), Nico (Jonah Blechman), Jarod (Jimmy Clabots) and Griff (Aaron Michael Davies) enjoy a crazy spring break in Fort Lauderdale when they compete in a "Gays Gone Wild" contest to see who can bed the most hunks. In order to come out on top, they'll have to conquer giant genital crabs and evil gay frat boys. This campy comedy also features RuPaul and Perez Hilton.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It

title.regular: Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild!
title.short: Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild!

link.synopsis: Shocked and disillusioned by the sudden death of his friend and would-be business partner, a lonely garbage man Nikander (Matti Pellonpaa) finds his hope restored by a chance meeting with a pretty supermarket cashier named Ilona (Kati Outinen). Beautifully realized by celebrated director Aki Kaurismäki, this offbeat tale demonstrates the affect that nuance, subtlety and character development can have on a conventional romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Carlos Saura's Flamenco Trilogy: El Amor Brujo
The Sacrifice / Directed by Andrei Tarkovsky
I Can No Longer Hear the Guitar
What Have I Done to Deserve This?

link.synopsis: Melik Malkasian stars in this charming offbeat comedy from director James Westby (Film Geek) as infamous adult filmmaker Arturo Domingo, the artist behind such catchy titles as Five Easy Nieces and Requiem for a Wet Dream. Poised to be honored with a lifetime achievement award in his hometown, Domingo plots to use the recognition to help revitalize his career and raise money for his next big project, Gang Bangs of New York.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
The Night of the White Pants
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst

link.synopsis: Caveman Ishbo (Adam Rifkin) definitely doesn't fit the mold. Tired of hunting, gathering and primitive tools, he yearns for something more. Unfortunately, his quest doesn't appeal to the girl of his dreams, Fardart (Ali Larter), who only has eyes for Ishbo's hunky brother (Hayes MacArthur). David Carradine and Talia Shire co-star as Ishbo's supportive parents in this Stone Age comedy, which Rifkin also wrote and directed.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
The Night of the White Pants
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Facing down his quickly approaching 30th birthday, gay librarian Omer (Tomer Ilan) hasn't found his place in life or his ideal man, until fetching journalist Ronen (Guy Zoaretz) enters the scene. Meanwhile, Omer's sister Shirley (Lucy Dubinchik) struggles to decide between settling down with the woman of her dreams and indulging her long-held fantasy of traveling to Antarctica. Yair Hochner directs this comedy that also stars Rivka Neuman.
link.title: synopsis
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes

link.synopsis: Robert Schimmel has faced it all -- cancer, a heart attack, divorce -- and managed to make his comedy all the funnier for it. This sidesplitting stand-up special features Schimmel speaking with characteristic bluntness about the past few years. From bargaining with God over his terminal disease to living with a teenage daughter to finding the perfect woman -- even though she's not his wife -- Schimmel finds the humor in it all.
link.title: synopsis
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
Craig Shoemaker: Live: That's a True Story!
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
John Witherspoon: You Got to Coordinate
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins

link.synopsis: Sidhu (Akshay Kumar) spends his days working at a roadside food stall in Delhi, India, but dreams of escaping his humble life. When he's mistaken for the reincarnation of an ancient Chinese warrior, he gets his wish in this entertaining Bollywood comedy. Whisked away to China, Sidhu enjoys the action-packed world full of martial arts assassins and mysterious women he's thrust into -- until he realizes he's expected to take down a brutal criminal.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: Following the untimely death of his best friend and business partner, cantankerous chauvinist Art Leroldi (John Ratzenberger, "Cheers") begrudgingly hires  female hairstylist Gloria MacIntyre (Shelly Cole) to save his struggling barbershop. This quirky indie comedy also stars Laurellee Westaway as nicotine-addicted, oxygen tank-toting neighbor Gladys and Cindy Pickett as Josie, the topless cocktail waitress who catches Art's eye.
link.title: synopsis
How to Be a Serial Killer
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: Comedian Ralphie May, voted one of Variety's 10 Comics to Watch in 2008, brings his outrageous, politically incorrect stand-up to a sold-out Texas audience in this comedy special, recorded live at Austin's historic Paramount Theatre. An equal-opportunity insulter, funnyman May keeps the laughs coming double time with his hilarious take on everything from racially mixed audiences to hot empanadas -- and everything in between.
link.title: synopsis
Ralphie May: Girth of a Nation
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 4
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle

link.synopsis: While waiting for his girlfriend to respond to his marriage proposal, half-white, half-Pakistani actor Ray (Zachary Levi) attempts to reunite his newly separated parents, falls for a girl who shares his same mixed heritage and begins exploring his own identity. Written and directed by Jaffar Mahmood, this romantic comedy about the intersection of race and relationships also stars Sarah Shahi, Bonnie Somerville and Kathy Baker.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Helmed by brother-sister team Jacqui Morris and David Morris, this witty metrosexual comedy charts the foibles -- romantic and otherwise -- of a bevy of London couples whose lives and loves are far from uncomplicated. Events come to a head at a disastrous but dead-funny dinner party, where pent-up tensions are released in this film narrated by a female artist who's worried that her current flame is a little too at ease with her gay friends.
link.title: synopsis
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
Love and Death on Long Island

link.synopsis: In writer-director Nick Whitfield's black indie comedy, a pair of "exorcists" (Ed Gaughan and Andrew Buckley) with the power to rid people of their secrets agree to help a woman (Paprika Steen) whose daughter (Tuppence Middleton) is mute -- and whose husband is missing. Jason Isaacs co-stars as the mysterious Colonel, who seems to be calling the shots from the sidelines of the duo's shadowy enterprise.
link.title: synopsis
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: Stand-up comedian Tim Allen became a comedy megastar when he used bits of his routine as the basis for this award-winning ABC sitcom about Tim Taylor, a devoted family man and the accident-prone host of the TV show "Tool Time." Tim's long-suffering wife, Jill (Patricia Richardson), tends to their three lively sons, while neighbor Wilson (Earl Hindman) dispenses useful advice and Tim's co-host, Al (Richard Karn), runs the show.
link.title: synopsis
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air

link.synopsis: Spike TV concocts hilarious comedy by blending re-edited footage from the Japanese game show "Takeshi's Castle" with outrageous commentary from comedians Kenny Blankenship and Vic Romano, who ridicule the contestants striving to win the dough. The unusual challenges include the Rotating Surfboard of Death and the Downhill Giant Rice Bowl Slalom, which confront teams such as Inventors vs. Ex-Child Actors and Wedding Industry vs. Trucking Industry.
link.title: synopsis
The Boston Red Sox: 2004 World Series Collector's Edition
RiffTrax: The Best of RiffTrax Shorts: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Farley
MTV: The Real World You Never Saw: Paris
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 1
The Ride: 7 Days to End AIDS
America's Funniest Home Videos: The Best of Kids & Animals

link.synopsis: This biting black comedy follows socially awkward newlywed Meris Canfield, who moves to Portland, Ore., with her hubby only to be deserted by him. She then befriends a wild child who introduces her to the joys of punk rock, sugar and self-discovery.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: In this installment of the smash-hit series of Comedy Central roasts, "Roastmaster General" Jeffrey Ross and celebrity pals of rock-rap musician Kid Rock use the bad boy's life and career as fodder for one raunchy, riotous joke after another.
link.title: synopsis
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son

link.synopsis: Catch a live performance of the genre-busting band Coheed and Cambria at the Starland Ballroom in Sayreville, N.J., featuring My Chemical Romance as its opening act. See them run through their hits, including "In Keeping Secrets of Silent Earth: 3," "Delirium Trigger," "A Favor House Atlantic" and more. Extras include a making-of video of "Blood Red Summer"; the "Devil in Jersey City" video; and an appearance at the 2004 Surf & Skate Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Coheed & Cambria: The Last Supper: Live at Hammerstein Ballroom
John Blackwell: Hudson Music Master Series
Pete Townshend: Psychoderelict: Live in New York
Mastodon: The Workhorse Chronicles: The Early Years: 2000-2005
Sonic Youth: Corporate Ghost: The Videos 1990-2002
The Work of Director Spike Jonze
Kenny Wayne Shepherd: 10 Days Out...Blues From the Backroads
Judas Priest: Rising in the East
Dream Theater: Score: 20th Anniversary World Tour with the Octavarium Orchestra
Neil Young: Sugar Mountain: Live at Canterbury House 1968
David Byrne: Live at Union Chapel
Elvis Costello & the Imposters: Live in Memphis
Roxy Saint: The Underground Personality Tapes
Cat Power: Speaking for Trees: A Film by Mark Borthwick
Mates of State: Two of Us
Hitting the High Notes: 2004 High Sierra Music Festival
Red Hot Chili Peppers: The Last Gang in Town
The Pixies: Sell Out 2004: Reunion Tour
Primus: Animals Should Not Try to Act Like People
Ben Folds and WASO: Live in Perth
Inside Nirvana: An Independent Critical Review
Willy Deville: Live in the Lowlands
The Black Crowes: Freak 'n Roll into the Fog

title.regular: Coheed and Cambria: Live at the Starland Ballroom
title.short: Coheed & Cambria: Live at the Starland

link.synopsis: Dynamic metal band Coheed and Cambria rock the house in this sold-out 2006 performance at New York City's Hammerstein Ballroom, which features state-of-the-art lighting and stage effects. Highlights include "Blood Red Summer," "The Crowing," "Delirium Trigger," "A Favor House Atlantic," "The Suffering," "Welcome Home" and "Everything Evil," plus exclusive backstage footage of the group getting primed for the show.
link.title: synopsis
Nevermore: The Year of the Voyager
Shadows Fall: The Art of Touring
The Moneen DVD: It All Started with a Red Stripe
Lamb of God: Walk with Me in Hell
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Mastodon: The Workhorse Chronicles: The Early Years: 2000-2005
Henry Rollins: Live in the Conversation Pit
Steve Miller Band: Live from Chicago
Korn: Live on the Other Side
Pendragon: And Now Everybody to the Stage
Stream of Passion: Live in the Real World
Series DVD: Metal and Hardcore Magazine: Vol. 1
Bernie Torme: Stratocaster Gypsy: From the Early Days of Gillian
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Living Colour
Heaven & Hell: Live from Radio City Music Hall

title.regular: Coheed & Cambria: The Last Supper: Live at Hammerstein Ballroom

link.synopsis: Progressive rockers Coheed and Cambria have built an aural world around the alternative universe of vocalist Claudio Sanchez's comic book series, The Armory Wars -- the plot of which unfolds in the four concept albums performed in these concerts. Filmed in October 2008 at New York's Terminal 5, this series of shows marks the first time the band performed each album in its entirety over the course of four consecutive nights.
link.title: synopsis
Coheed & Cambria: The Last Supper: Live at Hammerstein Ballroom
Bullet for My Valentine: The Poison: Live at Brixton
Dream Theater: Score: 20th Anniversary World Tour with the Octavarium Orchestra
The White Stripes: Under Great White Northern Lights
Sister Hazel: A Life in the Day
What's the Matter with Helen? / Whoever Slew Auntie Roo?
Mastodon: The Workhorse Chronicles: The Early Years: 2000-2005
Pearl Jam: Live at the Garden
Foo Fighters: Live at Wembley Stadium
Black Keys: Live at the Crystal Ballroom
Tom Verlaine & Jimmy Rip: Music for Experimental Film
Pat McGee Band: Vintage Stages Live
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Living Colour
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Rhett Miller
On Stage at World Cafe Live: Duncan Sheik
Live Earth: The Concerts for a Climate in Crisis
Bloodied but Unbowed: Bloodshot Records' Life in the Trenches
Korn: Live on the Other Side
Paper Rad: Taking Out the Trash / Faces in the Trash
Elvis Costello & Allen Toussaint: The River in Reverse
Pendragon: And Now Everybody to the Stage

link.synopsis: Born in Long Island, NY, and educated at Johns Hopkins, Dr. Rick Hodes has dedicated his life to helping heal the sick and poor of Ethiopia over the past 20 years. Making the Crooked Straight is a documentary about this remarkable man's journey to save the world by saving one child at a time.
link.title: synopsis
Triage: Dr. James Orbinski's Humanitarian Dilemma
Triumph at Carville: A Tale of Leprosy in America
Frontline: The Dancing Boys of Afghanistan
Omo: A Journey to the Primaeval Age
Small Voices: The Stories of Cambodia's Children

link.synopsis: Known for compressing Shakespeare's plays into hilarious one-minute versions for the attention-impaired, the Reduced Shakespeare Company focuses on American history in this fast-paced sketch comedy. Moving breathlessly from the discovery of the New World to George W. Bush's presidency in 90 minutes, the three-man troupe covers the question of who really discovered America, the complexities of Watergate and more -- all with hilarious brevity.
link.title: synopsis
The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged)
John Cleese on How to Irritate People
Coca-Cola: The History of an American Icon
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
National Lampoon Presents: Electric Apricot: Quest for Festeroo
Scumrock: It's Scumrock, Not Punk Rock!

link.synopsis: &NFb;&NFb_;Even though he's getting a bit long in the tooth, Sonny Hooper (Burt Reynolds) knows he's still the greatest stuntman in the world. That changes, though, when young daredevil Ski Chinski (Jan-Michael Vincent) begins performing bolder and more dangerous stunts. Thus begins the rivalry that drives this late-1970s action-comedy, which reunites Reynolds with Smokey and the Bandit co-star Sally Field and director Hal Needham.
link.title: synopsis
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: This triad of terror and thrills serves up a terrific taste of horror. In Evil Come Evil Go, an alluring woman with a wicked bent goes on a killing spree; Terror at Orgy Castle has a couple meeting a menacing royal named Countess Dominova at the formidable fortress in which they find themselves; and The Hand of Pleasure has marauding robots roaming the city streets in search of a CIA agent and his girlfriend.
link.title: synopsis
The Zodiac Killer / The Sex Killer / Zero In and Scream: Triple Feature
The Girl from S.I.N. / Henry's Night In: Double Feature
The Joys of Jezebel / My Tale Is Hot
Wilbur and the Baby Factory / Tanya
The Love Cult / Mundo Depravados: Double Feature
Girl in Trouble / Good Time with a Bad Girl / Bad Girls Do Cry: Triple Feature
Common Law Wife / Jennie, Wife/Child: Double Feature
Unholy Matrimony / My Third Wife George
The Beautiful, the Bloody and the Bare / Behind Locked Doors
Damaged Goods / The Hard Road: Double Feature
The Ultimate Degenerate / The Lusting Hours / In Hot Blood: Triple Feature
Angels / Getting into Heaven: Double Feature
Kitten in a Cage / The Girl from Pussycat
Tarz & Jane, Cheetah & Boy / Tarzun and the Valley of Lust
Carnival of Blood / Curse of the Headless Horseman
Elvira's Movie Macabre: Legacy of Blood
The Last House on the Beach
The Hollywood Strangler Meets the Skid Row Slasher
A Dog Called Vengeance / Scorpion Thunderbolt / Temple of Hell / Cannibal Curse
Terror Tales: Dr. Vampire / Death Kiss
Elvira's Movie Macabre: The Devil's Wedding Night
Elvira's Movie Macabre: Werewolf of Washington

title.regular: Evil Come Evil Go / Terror at Orgy Castle / The Hand of Pleasure: Triple Feature
title.short: Evil Come / Terror at Orgy Castle / Hand

link.synopsis: In this crime caper, a trio of fledgling jewel thieves decides it's time to break into the big time. Their plan? To smuggle emeralds from Mexico to the United States by implanting the gems inside a horse. But their plot quickly unravels when they discover there's a mentally unhinged maniac among them. Which one is it, and will the other two be able to make off with the loot in the end? Keith Carradine, Sally Kirkland and Tom Waits star.
link.title: synopsis
Shoot First and Pray You Live
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Ranger, the Cook, and a Hole in the Sky

link.synopsis: This charming independent comedy from Austin, Texas, tells the story of Sonny (Ryan Carnes) and Tony (Steve LiGambi), two business-school grads who open their own sno-cone stand as a way to steer clear of the corporate fast track. Frightened of their boss (Tony Sirico of "The Sopranos") and wary of their cougar-like sales manager (Morgan Fairchild), the boys jump headlong into their new endeavor, but discover that the sno-cone biz is no cakewalk.
link.title: synopsis
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector

link.synopsis: Emil Jannings earned a Best Actor Oscar for his nuanced portrayal of Sergius Alexander, an aristocratic czarist general deposed during the Bolshevik Revolution who ultimately escapes to America and ekes out a living as a Hollywood extra. But his past catches up with him when director Lev Andreyev (William Powell), a former adversary sent to jail by Alexander, casts the erstwhile general in a film about the Russian revolt.
link.title: synopsis
The Charge of the Light Brigade
The Passion of Joan of Arc
Chang: A Drama of the Wilderness
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
Laurel & Hardy: Be Big / A Lucky Dog
The Lon Chaney Collection: The Ace of Hearts

link.synopsis: Bent on destroying Germany's fighter plane factories during World War II, U.S. Brig. Gen. Casey Dennis (Clark Gable) sends bomber squadrons on dangerous suicide missions, convinced that sacrifice is the only means to victory. Dennis hides the emotional strain he suffers from his men and second in command (Walter Pidgeon). Van Johnson, Brian Donlevy and Charles Bickford also star in this drama based on William Wister Haines's stage play.
link.title: synopsis
Clark Gable Collection: The Tall Men
The Last Time I Saw Paris
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: The Steel Helmet

link.synopsis: In 1902, a small Filipino village is besieged by guerilla forces lurking in the surrounding jungle. In rides the U.S. Cavalry to save the day. But before the eager troops can effectively battle the rebels, they must first earn the trust of the locals. After the Americans team up with the villagers to build roads, schools and bridges, hearts and minds are won over in this 1963 war drama, shot on location in the Philippines.
link.title: synopsis
The Charge of the Light Brigade
Join the Marines / The Marines Are Coming
Inglorious Bastards 2: Hell Heroes / Bridge to Hell / Warbus 2 / Apocalypse Mercenaries
The Lonesome Trail / The Silver Star

link.synopsis: This direct-to-video thriller stars Michael Dudikoff as Rick Harding, a Gulf War veteran on a domestic mission. Assigned to interview the U.S. vice president (Michael Cavanaugh), Harding's journalist wife, Michelle (Amanda Wyss), is aboard a Washington, D.C.-bound plane when terrorists hijack the aircraft and threaten to turn it into a germ-warfare weapon against Los Angeles. Can Rick and a commando team board the jet in flight and save the day?
link.title: synopsis
NFL Films: Ice Bowl / Green Bay Packers History

link.synopsis: John Wayne stars as a French Foreign Legion pilot falsely accused of murder. To prove his innocence, Lt. Tom Wayne (Wayne) must rely on the help of his fighting comrades to defeat the enemies who are leading an Arab revolt. This film is a re-edit of footage from the 12-chapter 1933 Mascot film serial The Three Musketeers and stars Lon Chaney Jr., Jack Mulhall and Raymond Hatton.
link.title: synopsis
Winds of the Wasteland / The Lucky Texan
Seven Sinners / The Shepherd of the Hills

link.synopsis: Learn how the some of the 20th century's greatest military leaders brought their brilliance to bear on the historic confrontations of World War II. Gen. John S.D. Eisenhower hosts this exhaustive eight-hour set. The programs highlight the tactical prowess of Gens. Dwight Eisenhower, Douglas MacArthur, George Patton, Omar Bradley, Jimmy Doolittle, Adm. Chester Nimitz and many more. Ronald Reagan, Walter Cronkite and Raymond Massey narrate.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Picture: TV's Legendary Military Series
On Common Ground: A World War II Reunion
World War II with Walter Cronkite: War in Europe
War File: Great Sea Battles of WWII
Great Fighting Machines of WWII: Allied and Axis Bombers
Road to Victory: The Winning of World War II
Silent Wings: The American Glider Pilots of WWII
Nancy Reagan: The Role of a Lifetime
With God on Our Side: George W. Bush and the Rise of the Religious Right in America
Bedford: The Town They Left Behind
Dangerous Missions: Assault On Iwo Jima
B-24: Bombers Over Normandy: The Victory Bombers
B-24: Target Japan: The Victory Bombers
B-24: Target Nazi Europe: The Victory Bombers
Nuremberg: The Nazis Facing Their Crimes
A Newsreel History of the Third Reich: Vol. 9
A Newsreel History of the Third Reich: Vol. 8

title.regular: Top Command: The Great Generals of WWII
title.short: Top Command: The Great Generals of WWII

link.synopsis: Dolph Lundgren directs and stars in this high-octane thriller as rock drummer Joe, whose band is playing the biggest show of its career in Russia when mercenaries storm the stage and take hostages, thrusting him into an unexpected rescue mission.
link.title: synopsis
In the Name of the King 2: Two Worlds

link.synopsis: Paul Giamatti stars as himself, an actor in the throes of anxiety over an upcoming performance -- until he gives his soul to a mysterious company that promises to freeze and store it until he wants it again, along with his anxieties. But when his soul goes missing, Giamatti embarks on a journey to track it down. Along the way he learns a thing or two about engaging every human emotion, however difficult. Sophie Barthes directs.
link.title: synopsis
All My Friends Are Funeral Singers
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers

link.synopsis: Desperate for his father's approval, a teen turns a wholesome family business into a black-market operation in David Aronson's mischievous comedy. Eager 18-year-old Jimmy sets out to bolster sales at his dad's ice cream truck business, but the situation soon gets out of control when Jimmy teams up with a local drug dealer, a rival truck driver and a mysterious homeless man. Dallas Rolnick, Will Vandermast and Oscar R. George star.
link.title: synopsis
Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins

link.synopsis: Six well-to-do Brits wrestle with the ups and downs of modern relationships in this series. Dating, parenthood, breakups and hookups all become fodder for comedy as they attempt to make sense of the opposite sex and find happiness along the way.
link.title: synopsis
An Unsuitable Job for a Woman: Seasons 1 & 2
The Most Fertile Man in Ireland
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Womanizing frat boy Rich Bradford (Richard Scudney) is in for the shock of his life when he learns that his latest conquest, the beautiful yet mysterious Erica (Pamela Paige), is in fact his former frat brother Eric. Directed by Christopher Picone, this low-budget independent comedy also stars Jonathan Lay.
link.title: synopsis
NASCAR: The Ride of Their Lives
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee

link.synopsis: Camilla is a heartwarming comedy about two women (Jessica Tandy and Bridget Fonda) who become fast friends and hit the road for the adventure of a lifetime. While a confused husband, a desperate son, and a long-lost love frantically try to track them down, the women find themselves in some funny situations, including losing their car in a lake, being duped by a con man, and staging a kidnapping.
link.title: synopsis
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: As Mickey's (Billy Crystal) and Ellen's (Debra Winger) friends wait in a restaurant for the couple to arrive, the story of their relationship unfolds in a series of flashbacks. From their unusual meeting in France -- Mickey's traveling to bury his father, Ellen's an airline employee -- to their whirlwind courtship and marriage, it's been anything but an ordinary romance. Crystal also directed this poignant romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Hollywood icon Mae West stars in this 1933 comedy -- which she also wrote -- as Tira, a resourceful circus performer and swindler who, despite her natural distrust of men, falls head over heels for a handsome businessman (Cary Grant). One of the few Mae West films to elude heavy censorship, this entertaining tale is notable for featuring one of the bombshell's most famous quotes: "When I'm good, I'm very good. But when I'm bad, I'm better."
link.title: synopsis
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee

link.synopsis: Celeste Martin (Kim Basinger), a beautiful extraterrestrial, comes to Earth to save her own dying planet. But she soon meets unassuming scientist Steven Mills (Dan Aykroyd) and falls in love, agreeing to marry him. Steven doesn't have a clue about Celeste's true identity -- but his daughter, Jessie (Alyson Hannigan), suspects something isn't quite right. Jon Lovitz and Seth Green co-star in this far-out sci-fi comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Mom and Dad Save the World
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: A stern Navy veteran named Rock (Tom Berenger) and his partner, newbie Eddie (William McNamara), are thrilled when they learn that their next assignment is to escort the beautiful Toni (Erika Eleniak) to military prison. Once the road trip begins, however, the Navy men discover that Toni is a handful -- and that she'll do just about anything to escape. Dennis Hopper directed this lighthearted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Butch and Sundance: The Early Days
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

link.synopsis: When successful New York investment banker Daryl Chase (Orlando Jones) is framed for laundering millions for a Mexican drug cartel, he's forced to switch identities with low-life petty thief Freddy Tiffany (Eddie Griffin). Wanted by the FBI, Daryl makes a run for the border to find the one man who can clear his name. Comedy and chaos collide when he discovers that his new alias, Freddy, is even higher on the "most wanted" food chain than he is!
link.title: synopsis
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Nominated for four Oscars, director Silvio Narizzano's cheeky comedy stars Lynn Redgrave as 22-year-old Georgy, a chubby but sassy virgin who finds herself with two men on her hands. It seems that her dad's amorous, middle-aged boss, James Leamington (James Mason), wants to make her his mistress; meanwhile, the father (Alan Bates) of her narcissistic roommate's illegitimate child falls in love with Georgy. What's a dithering girl to do?
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Cinematography Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Cinematography Black and White nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: The Knack...and How to Get It
A Guide for the Married Man
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: When his beloved daughter wants a pony, railroad man and perpetual drinker Jack Griffith (Jackie Gleason) buys her the entire circus. But when his wife leaves him and takes the children with her, he follows with the carnival in tow to win back their hearts. Along the way, the gregarious drunk falls in with other shenanigans yet always finds a way to come up smelling like roses. The lighthearted Academy Award-winning comedy co-stars Glynis Johns.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: This 1942 comedy manages to eke out barrels of laughs from a contentious time in history, World War II. Joseph Tura (Jack Benny) leads a ragtag band of actors in Poland who come to the aid of an American soldier (Robert Stack) who needs help carrying out his work in the Resistance efforts. But it turns out that Tura's wife (Carole Lombard) is having an affair with the military man, which severely undercuts Tura's sympathies for the soldier.
link.title: synopsis
To Be or Not To Be
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

title.regular: To Be or Not To Be
title.short: To Be or Not To Be

link.synopsis: Screwball comedy is alive and well and personified by Barbra Streisand in this early showcase featuring more character actors than you can shake a shtick at. Babs is married to a struggling cabbie (Michael Sarrazin) who borrows money from a loan shark to seal a promising business deal. Trouble is, he can't pay off the interest fast enough. ...
link.title: synopsis
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Barbra Streisand... and Other Musical Instruments
Barbra Streisand: Timeless: Live in Concert
Barbra Streisand: The Concert: Live at the MGM Grand
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High

link.synopsis: Recounting how a volleyball team composed of transvestite gays and one transsexual competed in the 1996 national championships, this Thai comedy brings the issue of male effeminacy into a new light -- even while entertaining us in the "old" one. Based on a true story, the film captured the Audience Award for Best Feature at both the San Francisco and New York 2001 Lesbian and Gay Film Festivals.
link.title: synopsis
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man

link.synopsis: The first sequel to the underdog comedy The Bad News Bears sees the titular Little League team reeling from both their championship loss and the sudden loss of their coach. To redeem themselves, the team travels to the Houston Astrodome for a chance to play the top Japanese Little League team. Along the way, they go through two more coaches, discover a star pitcher and get into in all manner of mischief.
link.title: synopsis
The Bad News Bears Go to Japan!
Small Ball: A Little League Story
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
Out of Left Field: The Making of the Chinese Baseball Team
Major League 3: Back to the Minors
Still, We Believe: The Boston Red Sox Movie

title.regular: The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training
title.short: The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training

link.synopsis: Set around a salsa-dancing nightclub in modern-day London, three men (Craig Ferguson, Jimi Mistry and David Morrissey) and three women (Olivia Williams, Jane Horrocks and Catherine McCormack) fall in and out of love and back again, to the Greek-chorus accompaniment of two cab drivers (Ian Hart and John Thomson) who engage in an ongoing conversation about sex. This winning romantic comedy is  writer-director David Kane's second feature.
link.title: synopsis
The Dirt Detective: A History of Scotland
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Everyone's favorite screwball comedy trio -- Larry, Moe and Curly -- serves up familiar hilarity and mishaps in this collection of classic shorts produced between 1936 and 1949. They attempt to do good and solve crimes, but mostly they create chaos. The line-up includes "Calling All Curs" (1939), "Disorder in the Court" (1936), "Dizzy Detectives" (1943), "Flat Foot Stooges" (1938), "Crime on Their Hands" (1948) and "Who Done It?" (1949).
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Three Stooges in History
The Three Stooges: Nutty but Nice
The Three Stooges: Stooged and Confoosed
The Three Stooges: Goofs on the Loose
Three Stooges: Stooges and the Law
The Three Stooges: Stop, Look and Laugh

The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 2

The Three Stooges: Meet the Baron / Gold Raiders
The Three Stooges 75th Anniversary Edition: Tales from the Three Stooges Vol. 1
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
The Three Stooges: All Time Favorites
Snow White and the Three Stooges
The Three Stooges Go Around the World in a Daze
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

title.short: The Three Stooges: Cops and Robbers

link.synopsis: At his 81st birthday party, an old man closes his eyes and wishes he were 18 again. When he opens his eyes, his wish somehow has been granted: He and his grandson have switched bodies! Comedy ensues as each tries to deal with the other's life.
link.title: synopsis
King of New York: Special Edition
The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor

link.synopsis: Mark Lester directs this slapstick comedy about two down-and-out men, ex-cop Frank Dooley (John Candy) and disbarred lawyer Norman Kane (Eugene Levy), who try their bungling hands at private security and wind up facing the wrath of their new employer, Michael Carlino (Robert Loggia), a mob boss running a smuggling scam that the two unwittingly uncover. Meg Ryan also stars.
link.title: synopsis
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear

link.synopsis: In this enchanting Disney family comedy, a Southern California kid named Calvin Fuller (Thomas Ian Nicholas) is magically transported to the medieval kingdom of Camelot through a crack in the ground caused by an earthquake. Once there, he learns he was summoned by the wizard Merlin, who needs Calvin to save Camelot. Using dazzling modern inventions, can Calvin help King Arthur retain his crown and thwart the evil Lord Belasco?
link.title: synopsis
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie
The Pirates of Tortuga: Under the Black Flag
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Human Pets
Adventures in Odyssey: The Knight Travellers

title.regular: A Kid in King Arthur's Court
title.short: A Kid in King Arthur's Court

link.synopsis: Sinbad stars as wild and amusing Secret Service agent Sam Simms, who is assigned to guard Luke (Brock Pierce), the bratty 13-year-old son of the president of the United States (James Naughton). Things go well until the two must foil an assassination plot against Luke's father. Zachery Ty Bryan, Lisa Eichhorn, Blake Boyd, Erin Williby and Timothy Busfield co-star in this lovable comedy. David M. Evans directs.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
All Grown Up!: Dude, Where's My Horse?
All Grown Up!: R.V. Having Fun Yet?
All Grown Up!: Growing Up Changes Everything
As Told by Ginger: The Wedding Frame
All Grown Up!: Interview with a Campfire
All Grown Up!: All Grown Up ... and Loving It!
Hannah Montana: One in a Million
As Told by Ginger: Far from Home

link.synopsis: Juliette Binoche and Jean Reno star in this sparkling, romantic French comedy from writer-director Danièle Thompson (La Bûche). At the Roissy Airport in Paris, an artist (Reno) who's still pining for his ex-wife plots to stop her from marrying again. But he meets a tempestuous beautician (Binoche) at the terminal, and his plans change abruptly. Forced to stick together when they become stranded, the mismatched pair start to grow closer.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A troubling event hatches an unlikely romance between a stuffy American and a free-spirited European in this romantic Billy Wilder comedy. When his father dies in a car crash while vacationing in the Mediterranean, Walter Armbruster (a young Jack Lemmon) crosses paths with Pamela (Juliet Mills), who happens to be the daughter of his father's mistress, who was also killed in the crash. Against all odds, love blooms.
link.title: synopsis

The Wackiest Ship in the Army

The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Live a Little, Love a Little

link.synopsis: Tough cop Katie Coltrane (Whoopi Goldberg) never bargained on getting a dinosaur for a partner, but that's what happens in this futuristic comedy directed by Jonathan Betuel. Thanks to modern science, dinosaurs are once again roaming Earth -- but this time, they talk and act just like humans. Their first assignment? A murderer is on the loose, and his victims are prehistoric animals. It's up to Theodore and Katie to crack the case!
link.title: synopsis
T-Rex: Back to the Cretaceous: IMAX
Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone
Really Wild Animals: Dinosaurs and Other Creature Features
The Land Before Time: Adventuring in the Mysterious Beyond
Goosebumps: The Night of the Living Dummy III

The Land Before Time VII: Stone of Cold Fire
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
Baby: Secret of the Lost Legend
The Land Before Time III: The Time of the Great Giving
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
Journey to the Center of the Earth

link.synopsis: After being dumped by his girlfriend in this unusual romantic comedy, police officer Christoph (Christoph M. Ohrt) drowns his sorrows in liquor and awakes the next morning in bed with a car thief, Edward (Tim Bergmann), who happens to be gay. With no place to go, Christoph rooms with Edward, who ignores his assertions that he's straight. While everyone at work gossips about Christoph's sexuality, lovely Helen (Carin C. Tietze) romances him.
link.title: synopsis
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man

link.synopsis: A grindingly poor, elderly woman (Liz Smith) puts up with daily abuse from her husband, her children and her employer. Oscar winner Ben Kingsley makes a strong appearance as a friendly taxi driver in this black comedy directed by Mike Leigh that stands as a pointed indictment of sexism and the class system.
link.title: synopsis
Teresa of Avila: Personality and Prayer

link.synopsis: "Saturday Night Live" fans could always rely on the late Phil Hartman for his hilarious impressions and characters during his tenure with the long-running sketch comedy series, and this collection showcases the suave-voiced comedian's best work. The program features some of Hartman's most popular roles, including Bill Clinton, Phil Donahue, Frank Sinatra, the Anal Retentive Chef and the Unfrozen Caveman Lawyer.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers

title.regular: Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
title.short: SNL: The Best of Phil Hartman

link.synopsis: Comic Andrew Dice Clay stars as a private investigator trying to make sense of a rash of murders that has left a string of music-industry victims in its wake. The most recent casualty: a disc jockey (Gilbert Gottfried) with a penchant for verbal attacks. It's no surprise, then, that there's a long list of suspects with a beef against him in director Renny Harlin's pull-no-punches comedy. Wayne Newton, Lauren Holly and Priscilla Presley co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Rodney Dangerfield: No Respect: The Ultimate Collection
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Sometimes, taking a bite out of crime means getting involved, and the six church ladies in this wacky comedy, along with their new minister (Edward Herrmann), aren't afraid to kick some butt -- especially when the underworld moves into the neighborhood. These feisty amateur sleuths are ready to fight back hard! A cast of talented character actors -- including Alan Hale, Patsy Kelly, Cloris Leachman and Karen Valentine -- provides a ton of laughs.
link.title: synopsis
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
The Strongest Man in the World
Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
Rainbow Brite and the Star Stealer
